chapters.title: Prelude
chapters.info: al'Lan Mandragoran, p. 11—Uncrowned king of Malkier, a nation now swallowed by the Great Blight, and the son of al'Akir and el'Leanna, the last king and queen of Malkier. He is very tall, with long hair that he wears back with the hadori, a braided leather strap traditionally worn by Malkieri men. At his birth, shortly before the Trollocs overran Malkier and the Blight consumed his homeland, Lan was given four gifts (while still in his cradle): a gold signet ring, a locket, a sword, and an oath. Lan and his surviving Malkieri companions are the last of their people. He prefers to avoid Aes Sedai when possible. Lan has experience fighting the Aiel on the Shienaran Marches, long before the Aiel War even began. He is quite practiced in the ko'di, the Oneness, a concentration aid he uses to clear his mind for battle and other crucial situations. See also Damodred, Moiraine; Mandragoran, Akir; ti Mandragoran, Leanna.
